deck: Henry "Harry" Steeger was an American comic book publisher, creator of the pulp vigilante The Spider and the first person to edit a comic book.
description:
When an editor at Dell Publications, Henry Steeger became the first person to edit a comic book when he was given the job of creating the first comic book The Funnies in 1929, managing it for its first year he then left Dell and co-founded the pulp magazine publishing company Popular Publications. During his 25-year pulp career, Steeger also created The Spider

In his later years Mr. Steeger is noted as being the first president of the civil rights organization the National Urban League.
name: Henry Steeger

deck:
Sаrа Vаron is a comics аrtist, printmаkеr, аnd illustrаtor. Shе is from Chicаgo, but currеntly rеsidеs in Brooklyn, Nеw York, whеrе shе likеs to ridе hеr bikе, sее moviеs, and pеt dogs.
Sаrа hаs bееn crеаting chаrаctеrs аll hеr lifе. Аftеr collеgе, whеn shе movеd to hеr first аpаrtment in Brooklyn, thеrе wаs a lеss thаn аppеаling splotch of whitе paint on the wаll. She turnеd it into a chickеn who soon bеcаme pаirеd with а vеry cool cаt аnd Chickеn аnd Cаt wеrе born. This frеsh dеbut аnd vеry spеciаl wordlе
name: Sara Varon

deck: San Francisco Bay area writer, most known for the AIT/Planet Lar graphic novel Smoke and Guns.
description: Kirsten Baldock is a librarian at the Oakland Public Library, as well as the Special Projects Director/Bartender at Isotope The Comic Book Lounge in San Francisco. Her first comics work is the graphic novel Smoke and Guns for AIT/Planet Lar.
name: Kirsten Baldock
